definition: head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: It's all set up very nicely for the Milan derby next weekend ...
sentences.chinese: 這對於下個週末的米蘭德比是個不錯的兆頭。

sentences.english: Getting to the second date, however, is still a good sign.
sentences.chinese: 不論如何，同意進行第二次約會都是個好兆頭。

sentences.english: Plain and simple, a woman’s touch is a good sign.
sentences.chinese: 一個女性對你的觸碰顯然是一個好兆頭。

sentences.english: Recorded in ancient books see the Dragon represents a good omen and saw the snake is drought disaster.
sentences.chinese: 古書記載，看龍代表好兆頭，又見蛇，是大旱。

sentences.english: That's a good sign that these follicles are healthy.
sentences.chinese: 這是個好的兆頭，說明這些卵泡是健康的。

sentences.english: These sales figures are a good augury for another profitable year.
sentences.chinese: 這些銷售額是又一年可觀利潤的好兆頭。

sentences.english: That augurs well for recovery, at least in the near term.
sentences.chinese: 那是經濟復甦的好兆頭，至少在近期是這樣。

sentences.english: Could this be the start of something great for Japan’s downtrodden sex?
sentences.chinese: 這會不會對日本被壓制的性是一個好兆頭呢？

sentences.english: Those stormy clouds augur ill for a picnic.
sentences.chinese: 那些暴風雨前的烏雲對野餐是個壞兆頭。

sentences.english: It seemed a good sign that they're cordially hobnobbing at the first time meeting.
sentences.chinese: 第一次見面他們就談得這麼熱乎，看來是個好兆頭。

sentences.english: It was the tallest and thickest I had ever seen, a good omen.
sentences.chinese: 這是我見過的長得最高最密的玉米地，是一個好兆頭。

sentences.english: That was a good sign. Eagles were always seen as powerful bringers of Truth.
sentences.chinese: 這是一個好兆頭，鷹一直被看做強有力的真相的信使。

sentences.english: HERODIAS: I do not believe in omens.
sentences.chinese: 我可不相信兆頭這回事。

sentences.english: That kind of resiliency is a good sign.
sentences.chinese: 道指所表現出來的這種彈性是個好兆頭。

definition: going with nature and the seasons (TCM)
to revisit old haunts (idiom); down memory lane
success across the board/victory in everything one touches
to make a significant advance in one's career (idiom)/to get one's big break
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
to make an effort to become strong (idiom); determined to do better/to pull one's socks up
altar lamp burning day and night
Dacun township in Changhua county 彰化縣|彰化县[Zhang1 hua4 xian4], Taiwan
to have no sense of shame/brazen
